012     *******************************************************************************/
013    package net.sf.oval.internal.util;
014    
015    import static java.lang.Boolean.TRUE;
016    
017    import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
018    import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
019    import java.io.Serializable;
020    import java.util.Collection;
021    import java.util.Iterator;
022    import java.util.Set;
023    import java.util.WeakHashMap;
024    
025    /**
026     * @author Sebastian Thomschke
027     */
028    public class WeakHashSet<E> implements Set<E>, Serializable
029    {
030            private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
031    
032            private transient WeakHashMap<E, Object> map;
033    
034            /**
035             * Constructs a new, empty <tt>WeakHashSet</tt>; the backing <tt>WeakHashMap</tt> instance has
036             * default initial capacity (16) and load factor (0.75).
037             */
038            public WeakHashSet()
039            {
040                    map = new WeakHashMap<E, Object>();
041            }
042    
043            /**
044             * Constructs a new, empty <tt>WeakHashSet</tt>; the backing <tt>WeakHashMap</tt> instance has
045             * the given initial capacity and the default load factor (0.75).
046             */
047            public WeakHashSet(final int initialCapacity)
048            {
049                    map = new WeakHashMap<E, Object>(initialCapacity);
050            }
051    
052            /**
053             * {@inheritDoc}
054             */
055            public boolean add(final E o)
056            {
057                    return map.put(o, TRUE) == null;
058            }
059    
060            /**
061             * {@inheritDoc}
062             */
063            public boolean addAll(final Collection< ? extends E> c)
064            {
065                    int count = 0;
066                    for (final E e : c)
067                    {
068                            if (add(e))
069                            {
070                                    count++;
071                            }
072                    }
073                    return count > 0;
074            }
075    
076            public void clear()
077            {
078                    map.clear();
079            }
080    
081            /**
082             * {@inheritDoc}
083             */
084            public boolean contains(final Object o)
085            {
086                    return map.containsKey(o);
087            }
088    
089            /**
090             * {@inheritDoc}
091             */
092            public boolean containsAll(final Collection< ? > c)
093            {
094                    return map.keySet().containsAll(c);
095            }
096    
097            /**
098             * {@inheritDoc}
099             */
100            @Override
101            public boolean equals(final Object o)
102            {
103                    if (o == this) return true;
104    
105                    if (!(o instanceof Set< ? >)) return false;
106    
107                    final Set< ? > set = (Set< ? >) o;
108                    
109                    if (set.size() != size()) return false;
110    
111                    return containsAll(set);
112            }
113    
114            /**
115             * {@inheritDoc}
116             */
117            @Override
118            public int hashCode()
119            {
120                    int hash = 0;
121                    for (final E e : map.keySet())
122                    {
123                            if (e != null) hash += e.hashCode();
124                    }
125                    return hash;
126            }
127    
128            /**
129             * {@inheritDoc}
130             */
131            public boolean isEmpty()
132            {
133                    return map.isEmpty();
134            }
135    
136            /**
137             * {@inheritDoc}
138             */
139            public Iterator<E> iterator()
140            {
141                    return map.keySet().iterator();
142            }
143    
144            /**
145             * Reads the <tt>WeakHashSet</tt> instance from a stream.
146             */
147            @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
148            private void readObject(final ObjectInputStream ois) throws java.io.IOException, ClassNotFoundException
149            {
150                    // materialize any hidden serialization magic
151                    ois.defaultReadObject();
152    
153                    // materialize the size
154                    final int size = ois.readInt();
155    
156                    // materialize the elements
157                    map = new WeakHashMap<E, Object>(size);
158                    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)
159                    {
160                            map.put((E) ois.readObject(), TRUE);
161                    }
162            }
163    
164            /**
165             * {@inheritDoc}
166             */
167            public boolean remove(final Object o)
168            {
169                    return map.remove(o) == TRUE;
170            }
171    
172            /**
173             * {@inheritDoc}
174             */
175            public boolean removeAll(final Collection< ? > c)
176            {
177                    return map.keySet().removeAll(c);
178            }
179    
180            /**
181             * {@inheritDoc}
182             */
183            public boolean retainAll(final Collection< ? > c)
184            {
185                    return map.keySet().retainAll(c);
186            }
187    
188            /**
189             * {@inheritDoc}
190             */
191            public int size()
192            {
193                    return map.size();
194            }
195    
196            /**
197             * {@inheritDoc}
198             */
199            public Object[] toArray()
200            {
201                    return map.keySet().toArray();
202            }
203    
204            /**
205             * {@inheritDoc}
206             */
207            public <T> T[] toArray(final T[] a)
208            {
209                    return map.keySet().toArray(a);
210            }
211    
212            /**
213             * Writes the state of this <tt>WeakHashSet</tt> instance to a stream.
214             */
215            private void writeObject(final ObjectOutputStream oos) throws java.io.IOException
216            {
217                    // serialize any hidden serialization magic
218                    oos.defaultWriteObject();
219    
220                    // serialize the set's size
221                    oos.writeInt(map.size());
222    
223                    // serialize the set's elements
224                    for (final E e : map.keySet())
225                    {
226                            oos.writeObject(e);
227                    }
228            }
229    }
